messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart ceiling fan
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Oscillation
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Speed [SSPD]
        Parameter 1: []
          Enum
            Low
            Medium
            High
    Enable Oscillation [EOSC]
    Disable Oscillation [DOSC]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Can you turn the ceiling fan on and set it to high speed with oscillation enabled?

First, I identify the commands needed to fulfill the request based on the device structure. The user wants the fan turned on, speed set to high, and oscillation enabled.

The commands available are Turn On [DON], Set Speed [SSPD] with parameter values Low, Medium, or High, and Enable Oscillation [EOSC].

Step 1: Send Turn On command to power on the fan.
Step 2: Send Set Speed command with parameter 'High' to set the fan speed.
Step 3: Send Enable Oscillation command to enable oscillation.

Result: Execute commands DON, SSPD(High), and EOSC in sequence to turn on the fan, set speed to high, and enable oscillation.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart thermostat
  ***Properties***
    Current Temperature
      Float
      Range 5.0 to 35.0 Unit °C
    Target Temperature
      Float
      Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Mode
      Enum
        Off
        Heat
        Cool
        Auto
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 10.0 to 30.0 Unit °C
    Set Mode [SMODE]
        Parameter 1: []
          Enum
            Off
            Heat
            Cool
            Auto
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
I want to set the thermostat to 22.5 degrees Celsius and switch it to heat mode. How do I do that?

The device accepts commands Set Temperature [STEMP] with a float parameter between 10.0 and 30.0 °C, and Set Mode [SMODE] with enum values Off, Heat, Cool, or Auto.

Step 1: Use STEMP with parameter 22.5 to set the target temperature within the allowed range.
Step 2: Use SMODE with parameter 'Heat' to switch the thermostat mode.

Result: Send STEMP(22.5) followed by SMODE(Heat) to set the thermostat to 22.5 °C and heat mode.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart irrigation controller
  ***Properties***
    Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Float
      Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Watering [START]
    Stop Watering [STOP]
    Set Flow Rate [FLOW]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0.0 to 20.0 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ENSC]
    Disable Schedule [DISSC]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Please start watering with a flow rate of 15 liters per minute and enable the schedule.

The device accepts Start Watering [START], Stop Watering [STOP], Set Flow Rate [FLOW] with a float parameter from 0.0 to 20.0 L/min, Enable Schedule [ENSC], and Disable Schedule [DISSC].

Step 1: Use Set Flow Rate [FLOW] with parameter 15.0 to set the water flow rate within the allowed range.
Step 2: Send Start Watering [START] to begin watering.
Step 3: Send Enable Schedule [ENSC] to enable the watering schedule.

Result: Execute FLOW(15.0), then START, then ENSC to start watering at 15 L/min and enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart energy meter
  ***Properties***
    Power Consumption
      Float
      Range 0.0 to 10000.0 Unit W
    Voltage
      Float
      Range 100.0 to 240.0 Unit V
    Current
      Float
      Range 0.0 to 50.0 Unit A
  ***Accept Commands***
    Query Power [QPOWER]
    Query Voltage [QVOLT]
    Query Current [QCURR]
USER QUERY:
Can you tell me the current power consumption and voltage reading from the energy meter?

The device supports Query Power [QPOWER] and Query Voltage [QVOLT] commands to retrieve power consumption and voltage respectively.

Step 1: Send QPOWER command to get the current power consumption in watts (0.0 to 10000.0 W).
Step 2: Send QVOLT command to get the current voltage in volts (100.0 to 240.0 V).

Result: Execute QPOWER and QVOLT commands to obtain the current power consumption and voltage readings from the energy meter.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart window shade
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Int
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Shade [OPEN]
    Close Shade [CLOSE]
    Set Position [SETPOS]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
I want to set the window shade to 40% open. How can I do that?

The device accepts Set Position [SETPOS] command with an integer parameter from 0 to 100 percent to adjust the shade position.

Step 1: Use SETPOS with parameter 40 to set the shade to 40% open.

Result: Send SETPOS(40) to position the window shade at 40% open.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart water heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Float
      Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Float
      Range 0.0 to 5000.0 Unit Wh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Turn On [DON]
    Turn Off [DOF]
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 30.0 to 75.0 Unit °C
    Query Energy Usage [QENERGY]
USER QUERY:
Please turn on the water heater and set the temperature to 60 degrees Celsius.

The device accepts Turn On [DON], Turn Off [DOF], and Set Temperature [STEMP] commands with a float parameter between 30.0 and 75.0 °C.

Step 1: Send DON command to power on the water heater.
Step 2: Send STEMP command with parameter 60.0 to set the temperature within the allowed range.

Result: Execute DON followed by STEMP(60.0) to turn on the water heater and set it to 60 °C.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart air purifier
  ***Properties***
    Power
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Filter Status
      Enum
        Good [0]
        Replace Soon [1]
        Replace Now [2]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Power On [DON]
    Power Off [DOF]
    Set Fan Speed [SFAN]
        Parameter 1: []
          Enum
            Low
            Medium
            High
    Query Filter Status [QFILTER]
USER QUERY:
Can you power on the air purifier and set the fan speed to medium? Also, check the filter status.

The device accepts Power On [DON], Power Off [DOF], Set Fan Speed [SFAN] with enum parameters Low, Medium, High, and Query Filter Status [QFILTER].

Step 1: Send DON to power on the air purifier.
Step 2: Send SFAN with parameter 'Medium' to set the fan speed.
Step 3: Send QFILTER to retrieve the filter status.

Result: Execute DON, SFAN(Medium), and QFILTER commands to power on the purifier, set fan speed to medium, and check filter status.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart garage door
  ***Properties***
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Lock Status
      Enum
        Locked [0]
        Unlocked [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Open Door [OPEN]
    Close Door [CLOSE]
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Status [QUERY]
USER QUERY:
Is the garage door locked? If not, please lock it.

The device has Lock Status property with enum values Locked [0] and Unlocked [1]. The commands Lock Door [LOCK] and Unlock Door [UNLOCK] control the lock.

Step 1: Query the current lock status using Query Status [QUERY].
Step 2: If the lock status is Unlocked, send Lock Door [LOCK] command.

Result: Check lock status; if unlocked, execute LOCK to secure the garage door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: smart refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Float
      Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
        Parameter 1: []
          Range 1.0 to 10.0 Unit °C
    Power On [DON]
    Power Off [DOF]
    Query Door Status [QDOOR]
USER QUERY:
Please set the refrigerator temperature to 4 degrees Celsius and make sure it is powered on.

The device accepts Set Temperature [STEMP] with a float parameter between 1.0 and 10.0 °C, and Power On [DON] and Power Off [DOF] commands.

Step 1: Send DON to power on the refrigerator.
Step 2: Send STEMP with parameter 4.0 to set the temperature within the allowed range.

Result: Execute DON followed by STEMP(4.0) to power on the refrigerator and set temperature to 4 °C.
